reviews.review_msg: Great professor with a great sense of humor. Explains things really well and has a thorough understanding of  the topics discussed.
Srini is the best prof I've had at SFU. He explains things clearly, cares about his students, and posts all his lectures online ��

I have never had a class in my undergrad where the professor has explained and taught the concepts so clearly. He's extremely empathetic towards students and always pushed to help us learn in the best way possible. He successfully packaged and explained difficult concepts in a way that was simple to understand and apply. A real gem of a guy.
(BUS 474) Do not take her class. Again, do not take her class.

I took BUS232 with her. Avoid her if you can. She doesn't uses mic in her class making it very hard to hear her. She doesn't reply to emails. Avoid her if you can. IF I go to class I used to get so confused by her Explanations. She expected other students to answer the doubts of other students. You are on your own. Tough course.

Dr Aboukinane is very knowledgeable and with a lot of industry experience and very hands on! Definitely one of the best profs I had at SFU. Her classes definitely prepares her students  for the workforce.

Not a great prof. She's knowledgeable but in terms of teaching wouldn't recommend taking an operations course with her. Disorganized, gets very confusing because she isn't able to communicate what she wants. i took 474 with her. Its a great course, but would not recommend anyone taking it with her.

She is a very nice person, patient and caring. If you have any question, dont hesitate to ask her. The course load is relatively light compared to other 4 level business core courses, if you are good at teamwork. After I graduated for a year, she wrote me a recommendation letter when I applied for a MBA program.

Chehra is definitely one of the best Beedie profs I've had. She's quite laid back, and is pretty much always available for help. The course is mostly lecture based, but the textbook can somewhat help for exams. Participation does matter in the course as it accounts for about 20%, but she makes it easy to participate and score those easy marks!
She is a great prof . Very knowledgeable in operations management .

The course is fairly easy. There is no final, and midterm is open-book. The average is really high. She is definitely not the best prof. I didn't learn anything at this course, even though it supposed to have useful content.
Difficult to understand
BEST PROF EVER!
I am not naturally a math person but Dr. Gupta is organized and clear and made this course work.

Professor Gupta is very knowledgable in the field of Operations Management. His lectures enhance the understanding of course material by analyzing real business cases. The class focuses more on understanding and application than memorization. Exams are open book and open laptop. Definitely recommend taking all OPS courses with him!
Fantastic professor, I immediately registered for his other courses next semester.

Amazing prof! So helpful, and lectures are really clear and well organized.  One of the best profs at SFU.  Content is fair and work is what would be expected for a 4 credit course.  Pay attention and attend all classes, and you'll do fine as he is really a great teacher.
Top notch cases from top business schools. very interesting class and very helpful instructor. Makes sure students understand all the concepts.

Outstanding Prof. The way he teaches the course is amazing. U must work hard tho. Games in class make it more practical. Some may say he is 2 easy but I think he is jus right coz he makes sure things sink in thru class discussions of cases. Cases are top notch (HarvardBusinessSchool) but he is very lenient. Take him A++. I havent done final yet tho

I don't usually write these but Mona is easily one of the best professors I have had at SFU. You are doing yourself a disservice if you dont take BUS 473 with her. She had clear, well-paced lectures with lots of in-class time for examples and working through problems. She posts all lecture slides and notes on Canvas, and assignments/tests are fair.

Mona is a fantastic professor! She is knowledgable and passionate about what she teaches. Mona is also very good at explaining concepts to students for their level of understanding. She encourages questions and is accessible outside of class time for further clarification and help. I highly recommend taking any class that she teaches!

Mona is probably the best prof I've had at SFU! The concepts might seem kind of difficult at first, but the way she explains everything and the pace she teaches at makes it that much easier to understand. The assignments and exams were also very fair, and class was engaging/interesting. She is also incredibly smart and super nice!

Ron is an extremely nice and friendly person. His exams are easy because they are related only to what he has talked about in lectures and very similar with assignments, so no surprises and you better attend every lecture. The only bad thing is that his teaching might be a little bit disorganized, if you are lost, you can always ask him for helps.

For a 4 credit course, it was pretty straight forward and a lot of it was because of Ron. It was a 4 hour lecture but he never went the full 4 hours. A high average on the midterm average though so you must be on the ball with your studying to beat the curve.

If you have interests, Bus473 is very practical and fun course. Prof brings real-world issues/discussions to the class. He is an easy marker (Avg is B+/A-). Group projects/cases are a bit challenging, but you have weeks to work on them with your groups. So, pick a good team.

Horrendous prof, not worth your time and money!! His lectures are very dry and long, and are often not really related to the assessments. You will have to self-study and complete the textbook questions to pass his course. Compare his notes to other profs, and you will be shocked by how much info is missing on his lectures.

This is an advanced level of required operations management course. The content is great, and very useful and practical. The key is to stay on top of stuff weekly. Prof is great and available to help. Cases are a bit challenging.

He is one of the worse Business profs that I've ever had. His lecture notes have almost 0 useful information for the midterm.  He will go over 1or2 word problems in class, then ask the class to study off the textbook questions that are nowhere remotely close to what he has taught in class to be prepared for the midterm (all long-word problems).
Great smart prof who cared about his class and put questions we worked on in class for exam

Payman is very kind and does his best to accommodate students, for example he made our 30 min group presentation online instead of in-person which was a great help. The course material itself is incredibly outdated and there was too much time wasted during class. The supplementary videos are from the early 2000s and not applicable today.

His teaching will always be an inspiration to me. His clarity and excellent use of examples make the material he teaches easier to grasp, even if there are gaps in your background knowledge. Fair marking and clear course requirements. Strongly recommend for all the courses he teaches at Beedie.

Doesn't get better than this. Attend his classes, participate in discussions, if you have questions ask, and make sure you understand the lecture material, then you should be able to ace it. Such a great experience being his student.

I feel this was an unfair class. You really need to know a lot about stat/OM/math before you come in. He just expects you to know it, and tests material that you have not seen and not in textbook at all. It was really a struggle and was discouraging for anyone who works hard but don't have any Operation Management backgrounds.

I had Payman for 3 classes in my last year of my BBA and he is by far my favourite SFU Bus Prof.  He loves to laugh and joke around but he is also extremely smart and helpful.  If you actually try in his class he will be there for you 100%.  You'd be lucky to have him as a prof :)
Very Nice prof. Case study is extremely helpful and connect to reality. Best Prof I ever Had.

I took two of my MS classes with him and I am going to take the last one with him too. It's wonderful that SFU has such a great prof like him. Class participation is a really big deal. Try to understand the materials in class and ask questions if you are not following. Never wait till the last week before the exam.

I thought that Mike Johnson for 336 was excellent...but Payman was even better. It's because of these two profs that one of my concentrations is MS. He's really helpful, and really approachable - though he can be kind of strict towards students during in-class group presentations (but that's a good thing in the long run). Thumbs up.
